main.longTitle: An Ordinance to provide for the registration of funds as limited partnership funds; to provide for the operation, striking off, deregistration, dissolution and winding up of the registered funds; and to provide for incidental and related matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Limited Partnership Fund Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance—
section.def: agreed contribution (協定注資), in relation to a limited partner in a limited partnership fund, means any contribution (whether in the form of property, services or otherwise), valued at a stated amount, that the limited partner has agreed to make to the fund in the capacity of a limited partner;
authorized institution (認可機構) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);
authorized representative (獲授權代表), in relation to a limited partnership fund, means a person appointed under section 23;

certificate of registration (註冊證明書), in relation to a limited partnership fund, means the certificate of registration issued to the fund under section 13(1), 80(3)(a) or 82C(3); (Added 34 of 2021 s. 3)
company (公司) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
Court (法庭) means the Court of First Instance;
document (文件) includes a document in electronic form or any other form;
former Companies Ordinance (《舊有公司條例》) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
fund (基金)—see section 3;
general partner (普通合夥人), in relation to a limited partnership fund, means a partner in the fund that is not a limited partner;
group of companies (公司集團) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
in electronic form (電子形式) has the meaning given by section 20(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
investment manager (投資經理), in relation to a limited partnership fund, means a person appointed under section 20(1);
licensed corporation (持牌法團) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);

limited partner (有限責任合夥人), in relation to a limited partnership fund, means a partner in the fund whose liability for the debts or obligations of the fund is, under the terms of the limited partnership agreement of the fund, limited to the amount of the partner’s agreed contribution;

limited partnership (有限責任合夥) means a partnership consisting of—(a)one or more than one partner, each commonly called a general partner, who is liable for all debts and obligations of the partnership; and(b)one or more than one partner, each commonly called a limited partner, who—(i)under an agreement entered into among the partners in the partnership, agrees to make contributions (whether in the form of property, services or otherwise) valued at a stated amount to the partnership; and(ii)is not liable for the debts and obligations of the partnership beyond the stated amount;
limited partnership fund (有限合夥基金) means a fund registered as a limited partnership fund under section 12;
LPF Register (《基金登記冊》) means the register of limited partnership funds established and maintained under section 47;

private company limited by shares (私人股份有限公司) means a company that is—(a)a private company within the meaning of section 11 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); and(b)a company limited by shares within the meaning of section 8 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
re-domiciled company (經遷冊公司) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Added 14 of 2025 s. 284)
registered office (註冊辦事處), in relation to a limited partnership fund, means the registered office of the fund referred to in section 18;
responsible person (負責人), in relation to a limited partnership fund, means a person appointed under section 33(1);
solicitor (律師) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159);
specified fee (指明費用) means a fee specified in Schedule 3;
specified manner (指明方式) means the manner of delivery specified under section 94.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Meaning of fund

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), an arrangement in respect of any property is a fund if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: either or both of the following apply—

subparagraph.content: the property is managed as a whole by, or on behalf of, the persons operating the arrangement (operating persons);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under the arrangement, the participating persons do not have day-to-day control over the management of the property, whether or not they have the right to be consulted or to give directions in respect of the management; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the purpose or effect, or purported purpose or effect, of the arrangement is to enable one or more operating persons and participating persons, whether by acquiring any right, interest, title or benefit in the arrangement, to participate in or receive—

subparagraph.content: profits, income, gains or other returns which arise, or are expected to arise, from the acquisition, holding, management or disposal of all or any part of the property, or sums to be paid or expected to be paid out of any such profits, income, gains or other returns;
a payment or other returns arising from the acquisition, holding, management or disposal of all or any part of the property; or
a payment or other returns arising from the exercise of any right in, or redemption or expiry of, any right, interest, title or benefit in the arrangement.

subsection.leadIn: An arrangement is not a fund if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the arrangement is operated by a person otherwise than by way of business;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: each of the persons participating in the arrangement is—

subparagraph.content: a bona fide employee or former employee of a corporation in the same group of companies as the person operating the arrangement; or
a spouse, widow, widower, minor child (natural or adopted) or minor step-child of such employee or former employee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the arrangement is a franchise arrangement under which the franchisor or franchisee earns profits or income by exploiting a right conferred by the arrangement to use a trade name or design or other intellectual property or the goodwill attached to it;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.leadIn: the arrangement is made for the purposes of a fund or scheme maintained by—

subparagraph.content: the Securities and Futures Commission; or
a recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company,

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: the arrangement is made for the purposes of a chit-fund permitted to operate under the Chit-Fund Businesses (Prohibition) Ordinance (Cap. 262); or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the arrangement is an arrangement, or is of a class or description of arrangements, prescribed by notice under section 4 as not being regarded as a fund in accordance with the terms of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: clearing participant (結算所參與者) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);
exchange participant (交易所參與者) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);
recognized clearing house (認可結算所) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);
recognized exchange company (認可交易所) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);
recognized investor compensation company (認可投資者賠償公司) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Financial Secretary may prescribe arrangements as not being funds

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 3(2)(h), the Financial Secretary may by notice published in the Gazette prescribe, either generally or in a particular case, that an arrangement, or a class or description of arrangements, is not to be regarded as a fund.

Without limiting subsection (1), a notice under that subsection may prescribe the circumstances under which or the purposes for which an arrangement, or a class or description of arrangements, referred to in the notice is not to be regarded as a fund.

section.name: s6
section.heading: References to delivering documents
section.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to delivering a document includes sending, supplying, forwarding or producing it.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Eligibility

subsection.leadIn: A fund is eligible to be registered as a limited partnership fund if, on its registration as a limited partnership fund—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the fund has one general partner and at least one limited partner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the general partner in the fund is—

subparagraph.content: a natural person who is at least 18 years old;
a registered non-Hong Kong company;

subparagraph.name: 3a

subparagraph.content: a limited partnership registered under the Limited Partnerships Ordinance (Cap. 37);
a limited partnership fund;
a non-Hong Kong limited partnership with a legal personality; or
a non-Hong Kong limited partnership without a legal personality;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: every limited partner in the fund is—

subparagraph.content: a natural person (whether in the person’s capacity as trustee, or in the person’s own or any representative capacity); or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the fund’s name complies with the requirements in section 8;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: registration of the fund by its name will not contravene the restrictions in section 9;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the fund has an office in Hong Kong to which communications and notices may be sent;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the fund is not set up for an unlawful purpose; and
not all the partners in the fund are corporations in the same group of companies.

subsection.leadIn: Despite paragraph (i) of subsection (1), a fund that does not meet the eligibility requirement in that paragraph is eligible to be registered as a limited partnership fund if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it meets all the other eligibility requirements in that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the application of the fund for registration as a limited partnership fund contains a statement that—

subparagraph.content: all the proposed partners in the fund are corporations in the same group of companies; and

the applicant understands that if the fund is registered as a limited partnership fund, the Registrar may strike the name of the fund off the LPF Register if all the partners in the fund are corporations in the same group of companies after the second anniversary of the date on which its certificate of registration is issued. (Amended 34 of 2021 s. 5)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Requirements on limited partnership fund’s name

subsection.leadIn: For section 7(1)(e), a limited partnership fund must have—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an English name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Chinese name; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a name consisting of both an English name and a Chinese name.

subsection.content: The English name of the fund must contain the words “Limited Partnership Fund” as the last 3 words of the name or “LPF” as the last word of the name.
The Chinese name of the fund must contain the characters “有限合夥基金” as the last 6 characters of the name.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Restrictions on limited partnership fund’s name

subsection.leadIn: A fund must not be registered as a limited partnership fund by a name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is the same as a name appearing in the LPF Index;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is the same as a name appearing in the index of limited partnerships kept under section 13 of the Limited Partnerships Ordinance (Cap. 37);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that is the same as a name of a body corporate incorporated or established under an Ordinance;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: that is the same as a name of a re-domiciled company; (Added 14 of 2025 s. 286)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the use of which by the fund would, in the Registrar’s opinion, constitute a criminal offence; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that, in the Registrar’s opinion, is offensive or otherwise contrary to the public interest.

subsection.leadIn: Except with the Registrar’s prior approval, a fund must not be registered as a limited partnership fund with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a name that, in the Registrar’s opinion, would be likely to give the impression that the fund is connected in any way with—

subparagraph.content: the Central People’s Government;
the Government; or
any department or agency of the Central People’s Government or the Government;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a name containing any word or expression for the time being specified in an order under section 10; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a name that is the same as a name for which a direction of the Registrar has been given under section 42(1) or (2) or 43(1).

section.name: s10
section.heading: Financial Secretary may specify word or expression for section 9
section.content: The Financial Secretary may, by order published in the Gazette, specify any word or expression for the purposes of section 9(2)(b).

section.name: s11
section.heading: Application by proposed general partner

subsection.content: An application for the registration of a fund as a limited partnership fund must be made to the Registrar by the person proposed to be the general partner in the limited partnership fund (proposed general partner).

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be delivered in the specified manner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contain the information specified in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be submitted on behalf of the proposed general partner by a Hong Kong firm or a solicitor; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: be accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: the specified fee payable for lodging the application; and
the specified fee payable for the registration.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Hong Kong firm (香港律師行) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap.159).

section.name: s12
section.heading: Registration

subsection.content: The Registrar may, on application, register a fund as a limited partnership fund.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not register a fund as a limited partnership fund unless the Registrar is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on its registration, the fund meets the eligibility requirements in section 7; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application for registration meets the requirements in section 11(2).

section.name: s13
section.heading: Issue of certificate of registration

subsection.content: On registering a fund as a limited partnership fund, the Registrar must issue a certificate of registration to the fund.
The certificate of registration is conclusive evidence that the fund is a limited partnership fund.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Appeal against Registrar’s decision to refuse registration

subsection.content: If a person is aggrieved by a decision of the Registrar to refuse an application for registration as a limited partnership fund under section 12, 80 or 82C, the person may appeal to the Court against the decision. (Amended 34 of 2021 s. 6)
The appeal must be made within 42 days after the date on which a notice of the decision is issued by the Registrar to the person.
The Court may make any order that it considers appropriate, including an order as to costs.
If the Court makes an order as to costs against the Registrar in relation to the appeal, the costs are payable out of the general revenue, and the Registrar is not personally liable for the costs.

section.name: s15
section.heading: General provision
section.leadIn: A limited partnership fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a fund set up in the form of a limited partnership under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not have a legal personality.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Contractual freedoms among partners

subsection.content: The partners in a limited partnership fund have freedom of contract in respect of the operation of the fund.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the matters that may be determined by the partners in the fund in the limited partnership agreement of the fund include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the admission and withdrawal of partners in the fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the transfer of interests in the fund by the limited partners in the fund;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the organization, management structure, governance and decision-making procedures of the fund;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the investment scope and strategy of the fund;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the powers, rights and obligations of the partners in the fund;

paragraph.name: f
g
h
paragraph.content: the life of the fund with possibility of extension;
the frequency of financial reporting and verification of net asset value;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the custodial arrangement; and

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the dissolution procedures.

subsection.content: An arrangement in the limited partnership agreement of a limited partnership fund must not contravene this Ordinance or any other applicable law.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Distributions to partners
section.content: Withdrawal of capital contributions from a limited partnership fund, and the distribution of profits and assets of the fund, is permitted if the fund remains solvent following such withdrawal or distribution.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Registered office

subsection.content: A limited partnership fund must have a registered office in Hong Kong to which communications and notices may be sent.

The proposed address of the registered office in the application for the registration of the fund, as required under item 2 of Schedule 1, is taken to be the address of the registered office of the fund with effect from the registration until a notification of change in respect of the address is filed with the Registrar under section 25.

subsection.leadIn: If the fund ceases to have a registered office, the general partner in the fund commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s19
section.heading: General liability and management responsibility

subsection.content: The general partner in a limited partnership fund has unlimited liability for all the debts and obligations of the fund.
The general partner in a limited partnership fund has ultimate responsibility for the management and control of the fund.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsections (1) and (2), if a limited partnership fund has an authorized representative—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: both the general partner in the fund and the authorized representative have ultimate responsibility for the management and control of the fund.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Duty to appoint investment manager

subsection.content: The general partner in a limited partnership fund must appoint a person (who may be the general partner or another person) as an investment manager to carry out the day-to-day investment management functions of the fund.

subsection.leadIn: No person may be appointed as an investment manager of a limited partnership fund unless the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Hong Kong resident who is at least 18 years old;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a registered non-Hong Kong company.

subsection.content: The person proposed to be an investment manager in the application for the registration of the fund, as required under item 12 of Schedule 1, is taken to be appointed as an investment manager of the fund under subsection (1) with effect from the registration until a notification of change in respect of the investment manager is filed with the Registrar under section 25.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Duty to appoint auditor

subsection.content: The general partner in a limited partnership fund must appoint a person as an auditor to carry out audits of the financial statements of the fund.

No person may be appointed as an auditor of a limited partnership fund unless the person is a practice unit as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588). (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: An auditor appointed for a limited partnership fund must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be independent of the general partner in, and the investment manager of, the fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry out audits of the financial statements of the fund annually.

subsection.content: For subsection (3)(a), if a limited partnership fund has an authorized representative, the reference to the general partner in the fund in that subsection is a reference to the general partner and the authorized representative.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Duty to ensure proper custody of assets
section.content: The general partner in a limited partnership fund must ensure that there are proper custody arrangements for the assets of the fund as specified in the limited partnership agreement of the fund.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Duty to appoint authorized representative

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if the general partner in a limited partnership fund is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: another limited partnership fund; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a non-Hong Kong limited partnership without a legal personality.

subsection.content: The general partner in the fund must appoint a person as the authorized representative of the fund to be responsible for the management and control of the fund.

subsection.leadIn: No person may be the authorized representative of the fund unless the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Hong Kong resident who is at least 18 years old;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a registered non-Hong Kong company.

subsection.content: If the general partner falls within the description of subsection (1)(a), the person proposed to be the fund’s authorized representative in the application for the registration of the fund, as required under item 8(e) of Schedule 1, is taken to be appointed as the fund’s authorized representative under subsection (2) with effect from the registration until a notification of change in respect of the authorized representative is filed with the Registrar under subsection (6).

If the general partner falls within the description of subsection (1)(b), the person proposed to be the fund’s authorized representative in the application for the registration of the fund, as required under item 10(e) of Schedule 1, is taken to be appointed as the fund’s authorized representative under subsection (2) with effect from the registration until a notification of change in respect of the authorized representative is filed with the Registrar under subsection (6).
The general partner must file a notification with the Registrar if there is a change in the particulars in the LPF Register relating to the fund’s authorized representative.
The notification of change must be filed within 15 days after the change occurs.

subsection.leadIn: The notification of change must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delivered in the specified manner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accompanied by the specified fee payable for filing the notification.

subsection.leadIn: If the general partner fails to file the notification of change, the general partner commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: Without affecting subsection (6), if a person resigns as the authorized representative of a limited partnership fund, the person must file a notification of the resignation with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: The notification of resignation must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delivered in the specified manner.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Annual return

subsection.content: The general partner in a limited partnership fund must file a return with the Registrar within 42 days after each anniversary of the date on which the certificate of registration is issued to the fund.

subsection.leadIn: The annual return must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be delivered in the specified manner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: include a statement made by the general partner as to—

subparagraph.content: whether or not the fund has been in operation, or has carried on business as a fund, for any period during the 12 months before the anniversary; and
the general partner’s assessment on whether or not the fund will be in operation, or will carry on business as a fund, for any period in the 12 months after the anniversary; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the specified fee payable for filing the return.

subsection.leadIn: If the general partner fails to file the annual return, the general partner commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Notification of change

subsection.leadIn: The general partner in a limited partnership fund must file a notification of change with the Registrar if there is a change in the particulars relating to the fund after the registration, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the withdrawal, removal or replacement of the general partner in the fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a change in the particulars of the general partner in the fund contained in the LPF Register;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a change in the address of the registered office of the fund;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a change in the investment scope or principal place of business of the fund;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a change in the identity of the investment manager of the fund, or the particulars of the investment manager contained in the LPF Register;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: a change in any other particulars that the Registrar may specify.

subsection.content: The notification of change must be filed within 15 days after the change occurs.

subsection.leadIn: The notification of change must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delivered in the specified manner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accompanied by the specified fee payable for filing the notification.

subsection.leadIn: If the general partner fails to file the notification of change, the general partner commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Rights and liabilities of limited partner

subsection.content: A limited partner in a limited partnership fund has the right to participate in the income and profits arising from the management of the assets and transactions of the fund by the general partner in, and the investment manager of, the fund.
A limited partner in a limited partnership fund does not owe any fiduciary duty to the general partner, or any other limited partner, in the fund.
A limited partner in a limited partnership fund does not have day-to-day management rights or control over the assets held by the fund.
A limited partner in a limited partnership fund is not liable for the debts and obligations of the fund beyond the amount of the partner’s agreed contribution.

However, if a limited partner in a limited partnership fund takes part in the management of the fund, the limited partner and the general partner in the fund (and, if applicable, the fund’s authorized representative) are jointly and severally liable for all the debts and obligations of the fund incurred while the limited partner so takes part in the management.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Activities conducted by limited partner

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a limited partner in a limited partnership fund is not to be regarded as taking part in the management of the fund only because the partner conducts an activity set out in Schedule 2; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fact that a decision that affects or relates to a limited partnership fund involves an actual or potential conflict of interest is not of itself a reason to regard a limited partner in the fund who takes part in the decision as taking part in the management of the fund.

subsection.content: The enumeration of activities in Schedule 2 does not limit the circumstances in which a limited partner in a limited partnership fund is not to be regarded as taking part in the management of the fund.

For subsection (1)(a), if a limited partnership fund has an authorized representative, a reference to the general partner in the fund in Schedule 2 is a reference to the general partner and the authorized representative.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 4
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: specified person (指明人士), in relation to a limited partnership fund, means—(a)the general partner in the fund; or(b)the investment manager of the fund.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Duty to keep records

subsection.leadIn: The specified person of a limited partnership fund must keep the following records at the registered office of the fund or any other place in Hong Kong made known to the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial statements of the fund audited by the auditor appointed under section 21;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a register of partners;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a customer of the fund (including a limited partner in the fund)—the documents, records and files described in section 20(1)(b) of Schedule 2 to the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: documents and records of each transaction carried out by the fund;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the controller of each of the partners in the fund.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial statements must be sufficient to demonstrate and explain each transaction that the general partner in the fund carries out on behalf of the fund and provide an accurate account of the financial condition and performance of the fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the financial statements must be kept throughout the period while the fund is registered under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(b), the register of partners must contain the following particulars of the general partner (and, if applicable, the fund’s authorized representative) and each limited partner in the fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the partner or authorized representative is a natural person—

subparagraph.content: the full name of the person;
the person’s residential address;
the person’s telephone contact number and electronic mail address (if any);
the total amount of capital contributed by the person to the fund;
(in the case of a limited partner) the amount of the person’s agreed contribution;
the date on which the person becomes and (if applicable) ceases to be the partner in, or authorized representative of, the fund;
the date and amount of each contribution made by the person to the fund;
the date and amount of any withdrawal of capital contributions made by the person from the fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the partner or authorized representative is an entity other than a natural person—

subparagraph.content: the full name of the entity;

if the entity is a company incorporated in Hong Kong, a re-domiciled company or a registered non-Hong Kong company—the entity’s identification number with the Companies Registry; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 287)
if the entity is an authorized institution—the entity’s licence number with the Hong Kong Monetary Authority;
if the entity is an authorized insurer—the entity’s file number with the Insurance Authority;
if the entity is a licensed insurance intermediary—the entity’s licence number with the Insurance Authority;
if the entity is not incorporated or formed in Hong Kong and is not a re-domiciled company—the place of the entity’s incorporation or formation; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 287)
the address of the entity’s registered or principal office;
the entity’s telephone contact number and electronic mail address (if any);
the total amount of capital contributed by the entity to the fund;
(in the case of a limited partner) the amount of the entity’s agreed contribution;
the date on which the entity becomes and (if applicable) ceases to be the partner in, or authorized representative of, the fund;
the date and amount of each contribution made by the entity to the fund;
the date and amount of any withdrawal of capital contributions made by the entity from the fund.

subsection.content: For subsection (1)(c), the documents, records and files must be kept for at least 5 years beginning on the date on which the business relationship with the relevant customer ends.
For subsection (1)(d), the documents and records must be kept for at least 7 years after the completion of the transaction to which they relate.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(e), the controller of a partner is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c), a natural person who exercises control over the partner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the partner is a trust—

subparagraph.content: a natural person who is the settlor, trustee, protector (if any), enforcer (if any), or a beneficiary or a member of a class of beneficiaries, of the trust; or

if the settlor, trustee, protector, enforcer, or the beneficiary or the member of the class of beneficiaries, of the trust is another entity—a natural person who exercises control over that other entity; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the partner is equivalent or similar to a trust (regardless of how the entity is described)—

subparagraph.content: a natural person who, in relation to the partner, is in a position similar to the settlor, trustee, protector (if any), enforcer (if any), or a beneficiary or a member of a class of beneficiaries, of a trust; or

if, in relation to the partner, another entity is in a position similar to the settlor, trustee, protector (if any), enforcer (if any), or a beneficiary or a member of a class of beneficiaries, of a trust—a natural person who exercises control over that other entity.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (6) and this subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where an entity is a corporation, a natural person exercises control over the entity if—

subparagraph.name: A
B
C
subparagraph.content: exercises ultimate control over the management of the entity; or

subparagraph.name: D

subparagraph.content: the entity is acting on behalf of another entity over whom the person exercises control;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where an entity is a partnership, a natural person exercises control over the entity if—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is entitled to or controls, directly or indirectly, more than 25% of the capital or profits of the entity;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is, directly or indirectly, entitled to exercise or control the exercise of more than 25% of the voting rights in the entity;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: exercises ultimate control over the management of the entity; or

subparagraph.name: D

subparagraph.content: the entity is acting on behalf of another entity over whom the person exercises control;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where an entity is a trust, a natural person exercises control over the entity if the person—

subparagraph.content: is the settlor of the entity;
is the protector or enforcer of the entity;
is the trustee of the entity;
is a beneficiary or a member of a class of beneficiaries of the entity; or
has ultimate control over the entity; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: where an entity is not a corporation, partnership or trust, a natural person exercises control over the entity if—

subparagraph.content: the person ultimately owns or controls the entity; or
the entity is acting on behalf of another entity over whom the person exercises control.

subsection.leadIn: If subsection (1) is not complied with, each of the specified persons commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized insurer (獲授權保險人) means an insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41);
licensed insurance intermediary (持牌保險中介人) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41);
registered institution (註冊機構) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571).

section.name: s30
section.heading: Making records available

subsection.content: The specified person of a limited partnership fund must not make the records kept under section 29 available for public inspection.

subsection.leadIn: The specified person of a limited partnership fund must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: make the records kept under section 29 available for inspection and production of copies by an officer of—

subparagraph.content: the Companies Registry;
the Customs and Excise Department;
the Hong Kong Monetary Authority;
the Hong Kong Police Force;
the Immigration Department;
the Inland Revenue Department;
the Insurance Authority;
the Securities and Futures Commission; or
a department or agency of the Government, or a statutory body, that is specified by the Financial Secretary for the purposes of this paragraph in regulations made under section 92; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make the financial statements kept under section 29(1)(a) available to the general partner and all the limited partners in the fund for inspection.

subsection.leadIn: If subsection (1) or (2) is not complied with, each of the specified persons commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: statutory body (法定團體) means a body established or constituted by or under the authority of an Ordinance.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Notification of change of place in which records are kept

subsection.content: If there is a change in the place in which the records referred to in section 29 are kept, the general partner in the fund must file a notification of the change with the Registrar.
The notification of change must be filed within 15 days after the change occurs.

subsection.leadIn: The notification of change must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delivered in the specified manner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accompanied by the specified fee payable for filing the notification.

subsection.leadIn: If the general partner fails to file the notification of change, the general partner commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply if there is such a change only because of the change of the address of the fund’s registered office.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 5
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: accounting professional (會計專業人士) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 1 to Cap. 615;
Cap. 615 (《第615章》) means the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615);
legal professional (法律專業人士) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 1 to Cap. 615.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Duty to appoint responsible person

subsection.content: The general partner in a limited partnership fund must appoint a person (who may be the general partner or another person) as a responsible person to carry out the measures set out in Schedule 2 to Cap. 615.

subsection.leadIn: No person may be appointed as a responsible person of a limited partnership fund unless the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an accounting professional; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a legal professional.

subsection.content: The person proposed to be a responsible person in the application for the registration of the fund, as required under item 13 of Schedule 1, is taken to be appointed as a responsible person of the fund under subsection (1) with effect from the registration until a notification of change in respect of the responsible person is filed with the Registrar under section 25.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Schedule 2 to Cap. 615 has effect with respect to responsible person

subsection.content: Schedule 2 to Cap. 615 has effect with respect to a responsible person of a limited partnership fund.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a financial institution in Schedule 2 to Cap. 615 is a reference to a responsible person that is—

subparagraph.content: an authorized institution; or
a licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a DNFBP in that Schedule is a reference to a responsible person that is—

subparagraph.content: an accounting professional; or
a legal professional;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a relevant authority in that Schedule is—

subparagraph.content: for a responsible person that is an authorized institution—a reference to the Monetary Authority; or
for a responsible person that is a licensed corporation—a reference to the Securities and Futures Commission; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a reference to a customer in that Schedule is a reference to a customer of the fund (including a limited partner in the fund).

section.name: s35
section.heading: Offence

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a responsible person of a limited partnership fund that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation.

subsection.leadIn: If a responsible person knowingly causes or knowingly permits the fund to contravene a specified provision, the person commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: If a responsible person, with intent to defraud any relevant authority, causes or permits the fund to contravene a specified provision, the person commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at $500,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified provision (指明的條文) has the meaning given by section 5(11) of Cap. 615.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Application of Part 3 of Cap. 615

subsection.leadIn: Part 3 of Cap. 615 has effect with respect to a responsible person of a limited partnership fund that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a financial institution in Part 3 of Cap. 615 is a reference to a responsible person that is—

subparagraph.content: an authorized institution; or
a licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a relevant authority in that Part is—

subparagraph.content: for a responsible person that is an authorized institution—a reference to the Monetary Authority; or
for a responsible person that is a licensed corporation—a reference to the Securities and Futures Commission;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reference to “an offence under this Ordinance” in section 11(1)(a) of Cap. 615 is a reference to an offence under section 35; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the reference to “a specified provision as defined by section 5(11) or a provision specified in section 43(1)” in section 11(1)(b) of Cap. 615 is a reference to a specified provision as defined by section 35(4).

section.name: s37
section.heading: Application of Part 4 of Cap. 615

subsection.leadIn: Part 4 of Cap. 615 has effect with respect to a responsible person of a limited partnership fund that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a financial institution in Part 4 of Cap. 615 is a reference to a responsible person that is—

subparagraph.content: an authorized institution; or
a licensed corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a relevant authority in that Part is—

subparagraph.content: for a responsible person that is an authorized institution—a reference to the Monetary Authority; or
for a responsible person that is a licensed corporation—a reference to the Securities and Futures Commission.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Application of Part 6 of Cap. 615
section.leadIn: Part 6 of Cap. 615 has effect with respect to a responsible person of a limited partnership fund that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Application of Part 7 of Cap. 615

subsection.leadIn: Part 7 (except section 82) of Cap. 615 has effect with respect to a responsible person of a limited partnership fund that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1), a reference to a relevant authority in Part 7 of Cap. 615 is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a responsible person that is an authorized institution—a reference to the Monetary Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a responsible person that is a licensed corporation—a reference to the Securities and Futures Commission.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Limited partnership fund may change name by resolution

subsection.content: The partners in a limited partnership fund may change the fund’s name by resolution.
Within 15 days after the date of passing the resolution, the general partner in the fund must file a notification of the change of name with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: The notification of change must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delivered in the specified manner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accompanied by the specified fee payable for filing the notification.

subsection.leadIn: If the general partner fails to file the notification of change, the general partner commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 3; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Registrar to issue certificate of change of name

subsection.content: On receiving a notification of the change of a limited partnership fund’s name under section 40, the Registrar may issue a certificate of the change of name to the fund.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not issue the certificate unless the Registrar is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the new name of the fund is not a name by which a fund must not be registered because of section 9; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fund has paid the specified fee payable for the issue of the certificate.

subsection.content: The Registrar must enter the new name in the LPF Register in place of the former name.
The change of name has effect from the date on which the certificate of the change of name is issued.

The change of name does not affect any rights or obligations of the fund or render defective any legal proceedings commenced or continued by, on behalf of or against it. Any legal proceedings that could have been commenced or continued by, on behalf of or against it by its former name may be commenced or continued by, on behalf of or against it by its new name. (Amended 34 of 2021 s. 7)

section.name: s42
section.heading: Registrar may direct limited partnership fund to change same or similar name, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may by written notice direct a limited partnership fund to change, within the period specified in the notice, a name by which the fund is registered if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the name is, at the time of the registration, the same as a name that appeared or should have appeared in—

subparagraph.content: the LPF Index; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the name is, as at the time of registration, the same as a name of—

subparagraph.content: a body corporate incorporated or established under an Ordinance; or
a re-domiciled company; (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 288)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the Registrar’s opinion, the name is, as at the time of the registration, too like a name of—

subparagraph.content: a body corporate incorporated or established under an Ordinance; or
a re-domiciled company; (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 288)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the Registrar’s opinion, misleading information has been given for the fund’s registration by the name; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the name is a name by which, as at the time of the registration, a fund must not be registered as a limited partnership fund because of section 9(2)(a) or (b).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may by written notice direct a limited partnership fund to change, within the period specified in the notice, a name by which the fund is registered if, after the fund is registered by the name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a court makes an order restraining the fund from using the name or any part of the name; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an office copy of the order, and a notice in the specified form, are delivered to the Registrar by a person in whose favour the order is made.

subsection.leadIn: A direction may only be given—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c)—within 12 months after the date of registration by the name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(d)—within 5 years after the date of registration by the name; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(e)—within 3 months after the date of registration by the name.

subsection.content: The Registrar may, before the end of the period specified in a notice given under subsection (1) or (2), by written notice extend the period.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: court (法院) means a court of competent jurisdiction of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region and includes a magistrate.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Registrar may direct limited partnership fund to change misleading or offensive name, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may by written notice direct a limited partnership fund to change a name by which the fund is registered if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar is of the opinion that the name gives so misleading an indication of the nature of the fund’s activities as to be likely to cause harm to the public; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name is a name by which, as at the time of the registration, a fund must not be registered because of section 9(1)(d) or (e).

subsection.content: The fund must comply with a direction within the period of 6 weeks after the date of the direction or, if the period is extended under subsection (3), within the extended period.
The Registrar may, before the expiry of the period of 6 weeks after the date of the direction, by written notice extend the period.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Registrar may change limited partnership fund’s name in case of failure to comply with direction

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar by written notice directs a limited partnership fund to change its name under section 42(1) or (2), and the fund fails to comply with the direction within the period specified in the notice or, if the period is extended under section 42(4), the extended period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar by written notice directs a limited partnership fund to change its name under section 43(1), and the fund fails to comply with the direction within the period specified in the notice or, if the period is extended under section 43(3), the extended period.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may change the fund’s name—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.leadIn: if it is a name consisting of both an English name and a Chinese name, to—

subparagraph.content: a Chinese name that consists of the characters “有限合夥基金編號” as its prefix, followed by the identification number of the fund.

subsection.content: The Registrar must enter the new name in the LPF Register in place of the former name.
The change of name has effect from the date on which the new name is entered in the LPF Register.

subsection.leadIn: Within 30 days after the date of entering the new name in the LPF Register, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must by written notice notify the fund of—

subparagraph.content: the fact that a name of the fund has been changed;
the new name; and
the date on which the change takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must by notice published in the Gazette publish that fact, the new name and that date.

subsection.content: A change of name under subsection (2) does not affect any rights or obligations of the fund or render defective any legal proceedings commenced or continued by, on behalf of or against it. Any legal proceedings that could have been commenced or continued by, on behalf of or against it by its former name may be commenced or continued by, on behalf of or against it by its new name. (Amended 34 of 2021 s. 8)

section.name: s45
section.heading: Appeal against Registrar’s direction to change limited partnership fund’s name

subsection.content: If a person is aggrieved by a direction of the Registrar to change the name of a limited partnership fund, the person may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board against the direction.
The appeal must be made within 3 weeks after the date of the notice of the direction referred to in section 42(1) or (2) or 43(1).

section.name: s46
section.heading: Determining whether name is same as or similar to another name

subsection.content: This section applies in determining whether a name is the same as or too like another name.
If the definite article is the first word of the name, the definite article must be disregarded.

If any of the words, expressions or characters specified in subsection (4), or an abbreviation of any of them, appears at the end of the name, the word, expression, character or abbreviation must be disregarded.

subsection.leadIn: The words, expressions or characters are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “limited partnership fund”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “LPF”; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: “有限合夥基金”.

subsection.leadIn: The following must be disregarded—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: type or case of letters;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: spaces between letters;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accent marks;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: punctuation marks.

subsection.leadIn: The expressions in each of the following paragraphs are regarded as the same—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “and” and “&”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “Hong Kong”, “Hongkong” and “HK”;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: “Far East” and “FE”.

subsection.content: A Chinese character is regarded as the same as another Chinese character if the Registrar is satisfied, having regard to the usage of the 2 characters in Hong Kong, that the 2 characters can reasonably be used interchangeably.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Registrar Must Establish and Maintain LPF Register and LPF Index

section.name: s47
section.heading: Registrar must establish and maintain LPF Register
section.leadIn: The Registrar must establish and maintain a register of limited partnership funds to keep, in relation to each limited partnership fund, records of the information contained in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: every document that—

subparagraph.content: is delivered to the Registrar; and
the Registrar decides to register under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every certificate that is issued by the Registrar under this Ordinance.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to section 47

subsection.leadIn: The information records must be kept—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in a way determined by the Registrar so that—

subparagraph.content: the information relating to a limited partnership fund is associated with the fund; and
a person may retrieve all the information relating to the fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in a way that enables a person to—

subparagraph.content: inspect the information in the records; and
make a copy of the information.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (1), the information records may be kept in any form that the Registrar considers appropriate.

If the Registrar keeps an information record in a form that differs from the form in which the document containing the information was delivered to, or generated by, the Registrar, the record is presumed, unless the contrary is proved, to represent the information contained in the document as delivered or generated.

If the Registrar records the information contained in a document as required by section 47, the Registrar is taken to have discharged any duty imposed by law on the Registrar to keep, file or register the document.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: information record (資料紀錄) means a record required to be kept under section 47.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Registrar not required to keep certain documents etc.

subsection.content: The Registrar may destroy or dispose of any document delivered to the Registrar under this Ordinance if the information contained in the document has been recorded by the Registrar under section 47 in a way that complies with section 48.
If a document or certificate has been kept by the Registrar for at least 7 years for the purposes of section 47, the Registrar may destroy or dispose of the document or certificate.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Registrar must establish and maintain LPF Index
section.content: The Registrar must establish and maintain an index of the names of every limited partnership fund.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Unsatisfactory document

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division, a document delivered to the Registrar is unsatisfactory if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information contained in the document is not capable of being reproduced in a legible form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the document is neither in English nor in Chinese, and is not accompanied by a certified translation of it in English or Chinese;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the requirements specified in relation to the document under section 94 are not complied with;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the applicable requirements of the Ordinance under which the document is delivered are not complied with;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the document is not accompanied by the specified fee payable for filing the document;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the document, or any signature on the document, or any digital signature or electronic signature accompanying the document—

subparagraph.content: is incomplete or incorrect; or
is altered without proper authority;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: the information contained in the document—

subparagraph.content: is internally inconsistent; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: the information contained in the document is derived from anything that—

subparagraph.content: is invalid or ineffective; or
has been done without the authority of the general partner in the relevant limited partnership fund; or

paragraph.content: the document contains matters contrary to law.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: applicable requirements (適用規定), in relation to a document, means the requirements as regards—(a)the contents of the document;(b)the form of the document;(c)the authentication of the document; and(d)the manner of delivery of the document;
certified translation (經核證譯本) means a certified translation within the meaning of section 4 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
digital signature (數碼簽署) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553);
electronic signature (電子簽署) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553).

section.name: s52
section.heading: Registrar may refuse to accept or register document

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar is of the opinion that a document delivered to the Registrar under this Ordinance is unsatisfactory, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may refuse to accept the document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, after having accepted the document, exercise the powers specified in subsection (2) or (3).

subsection.content: The Registrar may refuse to register the document and return the document to the person who delivered it.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may also advise that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the document be appropriately amended or completed, and be redelivered with or without a supplementary document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a fresh document be delivered in its place.

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has not received a document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuses to accept a document under subsection (1)(a); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuses to register a document under subsection (2),

subsection.continued: the document is taken as not having been delivered to the Registrar as required or authorized by this Ordinance.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Registrar may withhold registration of document pending further particulars etc.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of determining whether the powers specified in section 52(2) and (3) are exercisable in relation to a document, the Registrar may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: withhold the registration of the document pending compliance with a request under paragraph (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: request the person who is required or authorized to deliver the document to the Registrar to do any or all of the following within a period specified by the Registrar—

subparagraph.content: to appropriately amend or complete the document, and redeliver it with or without a supplementary document;
to apply to a court for any order or direction that the Registrar considers necessary and to conduct the application diligently;
to comply with any other direction given by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: court (法院) means a court of competent jurisdiction of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region and includes a magistrate.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Appeal against Registrar’s decision to refuse registration

subsection.content: If a person is aggrieved by a decision of the Registrar to refuse to register a document under section 52(2), the person may, within 42 days after the decision, appeal to the Court against the decision.
The Court may make any order that it considers appropriate, including an order as to costs.
If the Court makes an order as to costs against the Registrar under subsection (2), the costs are payable out of the general revenue, and the Registrar is not personally liable for the costs.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Certain period to be disregarded for calculating daily penalty for failure to deliver document to Registrar

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document is delivered to the Registrar under an Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar refuses to register the document under section 52(2).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must send a notice of the refusal, and the reasons for the refusal, to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if another person delivers, on behalf of the person so required, the document to the Registrar, that other person.

subsection.content: If a notice is sent to a person under subsection (2) with respect to a document, the period specified in subsection (4) is to be disregarded for the purpose of calculating the daily penalty under an Ordinance that makes it an offence for failing to comply with a requirement to deliver the document and that imposes a penalty for each day during which the offence continues.
The period is one beginning on the date on which the document was delivered to the Registrar and ending with the 14th day after the date on which the notice is sent under subsection (2).

division.name: D3
division.heading: Registrar’s Powers in relation to Maintaining LPF Register

section.name: s56
section.heading: Registrar may require general partner to resolve inconsistency with LPF Register

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Registrar that the information contained in a document registered by the Registrar in respect of a limited partnership fund is inconsistent with other information relating to the fund on the LPF Register, the Registrar may give notice to the general partner in the fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating in what respect the information contained in the document appears to be inconsistent with other information on the LPF Register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requiring the general partner to take steps to resolve the inconsistency.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), the Registrar may require the general partner to deliver to the Registrar within the period specified in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information required to resolve the inconsistency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: evidence that proceedings have been commenced by the general partner as a partner in the fund in the Court for the purpose of resolving the inconsistency and that the proceedings are being conducted diligently.

subsection.leadIn: If the general partner fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (1)(b), the general partner commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Registrar may require further information for updating etc.

subsection.content: For the purpose of ensuring that a person’s information on the LPF Register is accurate or bringing the information up to date, the Registrar may send a notice to the person requiring the person to give the Registrar, within a period specified by the Registrar, any information about the person, being information of the kind that is included on the LPF Register.

However, in the case of a limited partnership fund, for the purpose of ensuring that the fund’s information on the LPF Register is accurate or bringing the information up to date, the Registrar may send a notice to the general partner in the fund requiring the general partner to give the Registrar, within a period specified by the Registrar, any information about the fund, being information of the kind that is included on the LPF Register.

subsection.leadIn: If a person or general partner fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (1) or (2), the person or the general partner commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Registrar may rectify typographical or clerical error on LPF Register

subsection.content: The Registrar may, on the Registrar’s own initiative, rectify a typographical or clerical error contained in any information on the LPF Register.

The Registrar may, on application by the general partner in a limited partnership fund, rectify a typographical or clerical error contained in any information relating to the fund on the LPF Register.
If, in relation to an application under subsection (2), a document showing the rectification is delivered to the Registrar, the Registrar may rectify the error by registering the document.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 94, the Registrar may, in relation to any document authorized to be delivered to the Registrar under subsection (3), specify requirements as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the form of, and the manner of delivery of, the document to enable it to be associated with the document containing the error; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the identification of the document containing the error.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Registrar must rectify information on LPF Register on order of Court

subsection.leadIn: The Court may, on application by any person, by order direct the Registrar to rectify any information on the LPF Register or to remove any information from it if the Court is satisfied that the information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is factually inaccurate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is derived from anything that—

subparagraph.content: is invalid or ineffective;
has been done without the authority of the general partner in the relevant limited partnership fund; or
is factually inaccurate or forged.

subsection.content: If, in relation to an application under subsection (1), a document showing the rectification is filed with the Court, the Court may require the Registrar to rectify the information by registering the document.

subsection.leadIn: The Court must not order the removal of any information from the LPF Register under subsection (1) unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: even if a document showing the rectification in question is registered, the continuing presence of the information on the LPF Register will cause material damage to the fund concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the interest of the partners in the fund in removing the information outweighs the interest of other persons in the information continuing to appear on the LPF Register.

subsection.content: If the Court makes an order for the rectification of any information on or the removal of any information from the LPF Register under subsection (1), the Court may make any consequential order that it considers to be just with respect to the legal effect (if any) to be accorded to the information by virtue of its having appeared on the LPF Register.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court makes an order for the removal of any information from the LPF Register under subsection (1), it may direct—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that a note made under section 61(1) in relation to the information is to be removed from the LPF Register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the order is not to be made available for public inspection as part of the LPF Register; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.content: no note is to be made under section 61(1) as a result of the order; or
any such note is to be restricted to providing information in relation to the matters specified by the Court.

subsection.leadIn: The Court must not give a direction under subsection (5) unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following may cause damage to the fund—

subparagraph.content: the availability for public inspection of the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the interest of the partners in the fund in non-disclosure outweighs the interest of other persons in disclosure.

subsection.content: If the Court makes an order under this section, the person who made the application must deliver an office copy of the order to the Registrar.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Registrar may appear in proceedings for rectification

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings before the Court for the purposes of section 59, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is entitled to appear or be represented, and be heard; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must appear if so directed by the Court.

subsection.content: Whether or not the Registrar appears in those proceedings, the Registrar may submit to the Court a written statement signed by the Registrar, giving particulars of the matters relevant to the proceedings and within the Registrar’s knowledge.
Unless otherwise directed by the Court, a statement submitted under subsection (2) is to be regarded as forming part of the evidence in the proceedings.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Registrar may annotate LPF Register

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may make a note on the LPF Register for the purpose of providing information in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a rectification of a typographical or clerical error contained in any information on the LPF Register under section 58;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a rectification of any information on the LPF Register under section 59;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a removal of any information from the LPF Register under section 59; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other information on the LPF Register.

subsection.content: A note made under subsection (1) is part of the LPF Register.
The Registrar may remove a note if the Registrar is satisfied that it no longer serves any useful purpose.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Inspection of LPF Register and LPF Index

section.name: s62
section.heading: Registrar must make LPF Register available for public inspection

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must make the LPF Register available for public inspection at all reasonable times so as to enable any member of the public to ascertain, in relation to a limited partnership fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: whether the member of the public is dealing with—

subparagraph.content: the general partner in the fund;
the authorized representative of the fund (if any); or
the investment manager of the fund,

paragraph.continued: in relation to the administration of the fund or its property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the particulars of—

subparagraph.content: the fund;
the general partner in the fund;
the authorized representative of the fund (if any);
the investment manager of the fund;
a former general partner in the fund (if any);
a former authorized representative of the fund (if any); or
a former investment manager of the fund (if any).

subsection.content: However, the Registrar must not make available for public inspection under subsection (1) any information excluded from public inspection by or under an Ordinance or by an order of a court.

For the purposes of subsection (1), the Registrar must, on receiving the specified fee payable for inspection, allow a person to inspect any document on the LPF Register in any form that the Registrar considers appropriate.

For the purposes of subsection (1), the Registrar may, on receiving the specified fee payable for certification, produce to a person a certified true copy of any document or information on the LPF Register, in so far as the document or information may be made available for public inspection, in any form that the Registrar considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: court (法院) means a court of competent jurisdiction of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region and includes a magistrate.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Registrar’s certified true copy admissible as evidence
section.leadIn: In any proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document purporting to be a copy of any information produced by the Registrar, and purporting to be certified by the Registrar under section 62(4) as a true copy of the information, is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
