paragraph.content: on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the document is proof of the information in the absence of evidence to the contrary.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Registrar must make LPF Index available for public inspection
section.content: The Registrar must make the LPF Index available for public inspection at all reasonable times.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Striking off and Deregistration of Limited Partnership Funds

section.name: s65
section.heading: Registrar may send inquiry letter to general partner

subsection.content: If the Registrar has reasonable cause to believe that, in relation to a limited partnership fund, any of the circumstances specified in subsection (2) exists, the Registrar may send to the general partner in the fund by post a letter inquiring whether the circumstance exists.

subsection.leadIn: The circumstances are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fund does not meet the eligibility requirements in section 7;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fund does not have an investment manager;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the fund does not have a responsible person;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.leadIn: after the second anniversary of the date on which the certificate of registration is issued to the fund— (Amended 34 of 2021 s. 9)

subparagraph.content: the fund is not in operation or is not carrying on business as a fund; or
all the partners in the fund are corporations in the same group of companies; and (Amended 34 of 2021 s. 9)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: if the fund is registered under section 82C—section 82E is not complied with in relation to the fund. (Added 34 of 2021 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: The letter mentioned in subsection (1) must be sent to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fund’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Registrar is of the opinion that the letter is unlikely to be received by the general partner in the fund if the letter is sent to the fund’s registered office—the general partner’s address.

subsection.content: If the Registrar is of the opinion that a letter under subsection (1) is unlikely to be received by the general partner in the fund, the Registrar may, instead of sending a letter, publish in the Gazette a notice that, unless cause is shown to the contrary, the fund’s name will be struck off the LPF Register at the end of 3 months after the date of the notice.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Registrar must follow up under certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, within 1 month after sending a letter under section 65(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar does not receive a reply to the letter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar receives a reply to the letter to the effect that the circumstance specified in the letter exists in relation to the limited partnership fund.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must, within 30 days after the end of that 1 month—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (4), send to the general partner in the fund by registered post another letter that meets the requirements set out in subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish in the Gazette a notice that, unless cause is shown to the contrary, the fund’s name will be struck off the LPF Register at the end of 3 months after the date of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The letter mentioned in subsection (2)(a) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refer to the letter sent under section 65(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: state that—

subparagraph.content: no reply to it has been received; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: be sent to—

subparagraph.content: the fund’s registered office; or
if the Registrar is of the opinion that the letter is unlikely to be received by the general partner in the fund if the letter is sent to the fund’s registered office—the general partner’s address.

subsection.content: The Registrar is not required to send a letter under subsection (2)(a) if the Registrar is of the opinion that the letter is unlikely to be received by the general partner in the fund.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Registrar may strike off limited partnership fund’s name

subsection.content: At the end of 3 months after the date of publication of a notice under section 65(4) or 66(2)(b), the Registrar may, unless cause is shown to the contrary, strike the limited partnership fund’s name off the LPF Register by publishing in the Gazette another notice declaring it to be struck off.

subsection.leadIn: On the date of publication of the notice under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fund’s name is struck off the LPF Register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fund ceases to be a limited partnership fund; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the fund was still in existence immediately before that date—

subparagraph.content: the fund continues in existence in the form of a partnership (continuing partnership); but
this Ordinance ceases to apply to the continuing partnership.

subsection.leadIn: Unless the continuing partnership is a non-Hong Kong limited partnership—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the continuing partnership is to be regarded as a partnership that is not a limited partnership; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the general partner or a limited partner in the former limited partnership fund is to be regarded as a partner in the continuing partnership.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Application for deregistration

subsection.content: The general partner in a limited partnership fund may apply to the Registrar for the deregistration of the fund.

subsection.leadIn: An application must not be made unless, at the time of the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the partners in the fund agree to the deregistration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fund has no outstanding liabilities;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the fund’s assets do not consist of any immovable property situate in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: An application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delivered in the specified manner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accompanied by the specified fee payable for lodging the application; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: accompanied by a written notice from the Commissioner of Inland Revenue stating that the Commissioner has no objection to the deregistration.

subsection.content: The applicant must give the Registrar any further information that the Registrar may request in relation to an application.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Registrar may deregister limited partnership fund

subsection.content: On receiving an application under section 68, the Registrar must publish in the Gazette a notice of the proposed deregistration of the limited partnership fund unless the Registrar is aware of a failure to comply with subsection (2), (3) or (4) of that section.
The notice must state that the Registrar may deregister the fund unless an objection to the deregistration is received within 3 months after the date of publication of the notice.

If, at the end of those 3 months, the Registrar has not received any objection to the deregistration, the Registrar may deregister the fund by publishing in the Gazette another notice declaring it to be deregistered.

subsection.leadIn: On the date of publication of the notice under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fund is deregistered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fund ceases to be a limited partnership fund; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the fund was still in existence immediately before that date—

subparagraph.content: the fund continues in existence in the form of a partnership (continuing partnership); but
this Ordinance ceases to apply to the continuing partnership.

subsection.leadIn: Unless the continuing partnership is a non-Hong Kong limited partnership—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the continuing partnership is to be regarded as a partnership that is not a limited partnership; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the general partner or a limited partner in the former limited partnership fund is to be regarded as a partner in the continuing partnership.

subsection.content: On the deregistration of the fund, the Registrar must give notice of the deregistration to the applicant.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Dissolution and Winding up of Limited Partnership Funds

section.name: s70
section.heading: Dissolution without Court order

subsection.content: A limited partnership fund may be dissolved in accordance with the limited partnership agreement of the fund.

subsection.leadIn: In addition—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.content: the general partner in, or (if applicable) the authorized representative of, the fund is bankrupt, dissolved or dead;

a winding-up order is made by the Court under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), or a similar order is made under the laws of a jurisdiction outside Hong Kong, in respect of the general partner in, or (if applicable) the authorized representative of, the fund; or
the general partner in, or (if applicable) the authorized representative of, the fund ceases to be such; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the general partner or authorized representative is not replaced within a period of 30 days after the date on which the circumstance referred to in paragraph (a) arises,

subsection.continued: the fund is dissolved on the expiry of the period.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: section 23 no longer applies in relation to the fund.

subsection.content: The general partner in, and (if applicable) the authorized representative of, a limited partnership fund must each ensure that a notification of dissolution is filed with the Registrar in accordance with subsection (6) within 15 days after the fund is dissolved under subsection (1) or (2).

If a limited partnership fund has neither a general partner nor an authorized representative when it is dissolved under subsection (1) or (2), each limited partner in the fund must ensure that a notification of dissolution is filed with the Registrar in accordance with subsection (6) within 15 days after the fund is so dissolved.

subsection.leadIn: The notification of dissolution must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delivered in the specified manner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the limited partnership fund is dissolved by a resolution of the partners in the fund—accompanied by a copy of the resolution; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: accompanied by the specified fee payable for filing the notification.

subsection.leadIn: A person who fails to comply with subsection (4) or (5) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Dissolution ordered by Court

subsection.leadIn: On application by a partner in, or a creditor of, a limited partnership fund, the Court may order a dissolution of the fund if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Court, having regard to the nature of the business of the fund, is of the opinion that a partner in the fund (other than the applicant partner) has done any act or made any omission calculated to affect prejudicially the carrying on of the business of the fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a partner in the fund (other than the applicant partner)—

subparagraph.content: wilfully or persistently commits a breach of the limited partnership agreement of the fund; or

otherwise so conducts themselves in matters relating to the business of the fund that it is not reasonably practicable for the other partner or partners to carry on the business in partnership with that partner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the business of the fund can only be carried on at a loss;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Court is of the opinion that it is just and equitable that the fund be dissolved;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the general partner in the fund is mentally incapacitated (as defined by section 2(1) of the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136)); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the general partner in the fund becomes in any other way permanently incapable of performing their part of the limited partnership agreement.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of subsection (1)(e), the application may also be made by—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a next friend of the general partner; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person having title to intervene.

subsection.content: If the Court makes an order under subsection (1), the person who makes the application for the order must file a copy of the order with the Registrar within 15 days after the order is made.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: applicant partner (申請合夥人), in relation to an application made under subsection (1) by a partner in a limited partnership fund, means that partner.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Keeping of records of dissolved limited partnership fund

subsection.content: If a limited partnership fund is dissolved, the former general partner in, and the former investment manager of, the fund must each ensure that the records of the fund that are required to be kept under section 29(1) are kept for at least 6 years after the date of the dissolution.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to the former general partner in a limited partnership fund is a reference to the person who is the general partner in the fund immediately before the fund is dissolved; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to the former investment manager of a limited partnership fund is a reference to the person who is the investment manager of the fund immediately before the fund is dissolved.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to the records that are otherwise required to be kept by another person under this Ordinance or any other Ordinance.
A person who fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 2
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: member (成員), in relation to an entity, means—(a)if the entity is a limited partnership fund—a partner in that fund or the authorized representative of that fund (if any);(b)if the entity is a partnership other than a limited partnership fund—a partner in that partnership; or(c)if the entity is a body of persons of any other kind—a member of that body.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Winding up of limited partnership fund

subsection.content: For the purposes of Part X of Cap. 32, a limited partnership fund is an unregistered company within the meaning of that Part.

subsection.leadIn: Accordingly, in relation to the winding up of a limited partnership fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Part X of Cap. 32 applies subject to sections 75 and 77; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other provisions of Cap. 32 apply by virtue of section 327(1) of Cap. 32 subject to necessary modifications, including those set out in sections 76 and 77.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Application of Part X of Cap. 32 to winding up of limited partnership fund

subsection.content: Section 326(1)(b) of Cap. 32 does not apply to a limited partnership fund.

subsection.leadIn: Apart from the circumstances mentioned in section 327(3) of Cap. 32, a limited partnership fund may be wound up by the Court, on the application of the Registrar by petition, if it appears to the Court that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fund is being carried on for an unlawful purpose or any purpose that is lawful itself but cannot be carried out by the fund; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obligations under this Ordinance have been persistently breached in relation to the fund.

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 327(4)(a)(i) of Cap. 32, apart from sub-subparagraphs (A), (B) and (C) of that section, the written demand referred to in that section is taken to have been served on a limited partnership fund if it has been served by leaving it at the registered office of the fund.
Subsections (5), (6), (7) and (8) have effect in place of section 328(1) of Cap. 32.

subsection.leadIn: If a limited partnership fund is being wound up, each of the partners in the fund and (if applicable) the authorized representative of the fund is a contributory and is, subject to sections 19(1) and (3) and 26(4) and (5), liable to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pay or contribute to the payment of any debt or liability of the fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: pay or contribute to the payment of any sum for the adjustment of their rights among themselves;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: pay or contribute to the payment of the costs and expenses of winding up the fund; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: contribute to the assets of the fund all sums due from each of them in respect of any liability under paragraph (a), (b) or (c).

subsection.content: For the winding up of a limited partnership fund, if a contributory entity is a body of persons without a legal personality, each member of the entity is taken to be a contributory.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (6)—
subsection.def: contributory entity (分擔人實體) means an entity—(a)that is a contributory under subsection (5); or(b)that is taken to be a contributory because of subsection (6).

subsection.content: Unless otherwise specified in the limited partnership agreement of a limited partnership fund, the voting right of each contributory at a meeting of the contributories of the fund is to be determined in accordance with the proportion of the capital of the fund contributed by the contributory (excluding the amount of any capital contribution that has been withdrawn).

section.name: s76
section.heading: Application of other provisions of Cap. 32 to winding up of limited partnership fund

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions of Cap. 32 do not apply to the winding up of a limited partnership fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Part IVA;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: paragraphs (a), (d) and (e) in the proviso in section 179(1); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Part VI.

subsection.content: Section 182 of Cap. 32 applies as if the words “interests in the limited partnership fund” were substituted for the word “shares” in that section.

subsection.leadIn: Section 262B of Cap. 32 applies as if the following were added after subsection (3)(e) of that section—

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: if the company is a limited partnership fund—the investment manager of the fund;”.

subsection.leadIn: Section 262D of Cap. 32 applies as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following were added after subsection (2)(a)(v) of that section—

subparagraph.name: 5a
subparagraph.content: if the company is a limited partnership fund—the investment manager of the fund;”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in subsection (2)(b), (c)(ii) and (d)(ii) of that section, the words “paragraph (a)(iii), (v), (va), (vi) or (vii)” were substituted for the words “paragraph (a)(iii), (v), (vi) or (vii)”.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Meaning of certain expressions in Cap. 32

subsection.leadIn: In applying a provision of Cap. 32 applicable to a company being wound up to the winding up of a limited partnership fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a member of the company is a reference to—

subparagraph.content: (subject to subsection (2)) a partner in the fund; or
the authorized representative of the fund (if any);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a director of the company is a reference to—

subparagraph.content: the general partner in the fund;
the authorized representative of the fund (if any); or
any person who takes or took part in the management of the fund at any time;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to an officer of the company is a reference to—

subparagraph.content: the general partner in the fund;
the authorized representative of the fund (if any);
any person who takes or took part in the management of the fund at any time; or
the investment manager of the fund; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a reference to the articles of association of the company is a reference to the limited partnership agreement of the fund.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(i), if a partner entity in the limited partnership fund is a body of persons without a legal personality, each member of the entity is taken to be a partner in the fund.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: partner entity (合夥人實體), in relation to a limited partnership fund, means an entity—(a)that is a partner in the fund; or(b)that is taken to be a partner in the fund because of subsection (2).

part.name: P7
part.heading: Migration of Fund Set up in Form of Limited Partnership Registered under Limited Partnerships Ordinance to this Ordinance

section.name: s78
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 7
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: Cap. 37 (《第37章》) means the Limited Partnerships Ordinance (Cap. 37);
specified fund (指明基金) means a fund set up in the form of a limited partnership registered under Cap. 37;
specified partnership (指明合夥), in relation to a specified fund, means the limited partnership in the form of which the fund is set up.

section.name: s79
section.heading: Application for registration of specified fund as limited partnership fund

subsection.content: A specified fund is eligible to be registered as a limited partnership fund if it meets the eligibility requirements in section 7.

An application for the registration of a specified fund as a limited partnership fund must be made to the Registrar by a general partner in the specified partnership who is named in the application as the person proposed to be the general partner in the limited partnership fund.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delivered in the specified manner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: the specified fee payable for lodging the application; and
the specified fee payable for the registration.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Registration

subsection.content: The Registrar may, on application, register a specified fund as a limited partnership fund.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not register a specified fund as a limited partnership fund unless the Registrar is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on its registration, the fund meets the eligibility requirements in section 7; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application meets the requirements in section 79(3).

subsection.leadIn: On registering a specified fund as a limited partnership fund, the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of registration to the fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give notice in the Gazette of the registration.

subsection.content: The certificate of registration is conclusive evidence that the fund is a limited partnership fund.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Effect of registration of specified fund as limited partnership fund

subsection.leadIn: If a specified fund is registered as a limited partnership fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration does not cause the partnership that was registered as the specified partnership (partnership) to be dissolved;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the partnership continues in existence as a limited partnership fund; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: with effect from the registration date, the partnership is taken to be a limited partnership fund registered under section 12 and, accordingly—

subparagraph.content: the partnership ceases to be registered under Cap. 37; and
this Ordinance applies, and Cap. 37 ceases to apply, to the partnership (registered as a limited partnership fund).

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with effect from the registration date, all property of the specified partnership is the property of the limited partnership fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for tax purposes, the registration of the specified fund as a limited partnership fund does not amount to—

subparagraph.content: a transfer of assets of the fund; or
a change in the beneficial ownership of the assets of the fund.

subsection.content: For subsection (1)(c)(i), the Registrar must update the records in relation to the specified partnership in the register and the index kept at the Registrar’s office under section 13 of Cap. 37.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Business registration

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before a specified fund is registered as a limited partnership fund, the specified partnership holds a valid business registration certificate, the general partner in the limited partnership fund must, within 1 month after the registration date, notify the Commissioner of Inland Revenue of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name in which the limited partnership fund is registered; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the details of the general partner in the limited partnership fund.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: valid business registration certificate (有效商業登記證) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310).

part.name: P7A
part.heading: Re-domiciliation of Fund Set up in Form of Non-Hong Kong Limited Partnership

section.name: s82A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 7A

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: application date (申請日期), in relation to a non-Hong Kong fund, means the date on which an application under section 82B is made in respect of the fund;
deregister (撤銷註冊) means to cease the establishment in a place of establishment;

establishment (設立) means having a registration, permission or authorization (however described) under the law of a jurisdiction outside Hong Kong that gives effect to or evidences the formation or domicile of a non-Hong Kong fund in the jurisdiction, and established (設立) is to be construed accordingly;
non-Hong Kong fund (非香港基金) means a fund that is set up in the form of a non-Hong Kong limited partnership as at the application date;
original partnership (原合夥), in relation to a non-Hong Kong fund, means the partnership in the form of which the fund is set up;

registration date (註冊日期), in relation to a non-Hong Kong fund registered as a limited partnership fund, means the registration date specified on the certificate of registration issued under section 82C(3).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a requirement prescribed in this Ordinance applies in relation to the place of establishment of a non-Hong Kong fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is more than one place of establishment in respect of the fund,

subsection.continued: the requirement applies in relation to each place of establishment.

section.name: s82B
section.heading: Application for registration of non-Hong Kong fund as limited partnership fund

subsection.content: A non-Hong Kong fund is eligible to be registered as a limited partnership fund if it meets the eligibility requirements in section 7.

An application for the registration of a non-Hong Kong fund as a limited partnership fund must be made to the Registrar by a general partner in the non-Hong Kong fund who is named in the application as the person proposed to be the general partner in the limited partnership fund (proposed general partner).

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be delivered in the specified manner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: contain—

subparagraph.content: the name or names of the non-Hong Kong fund as at the application date;
the place of establishment of the non-Hong Kong fund;
a statement mentioned in subsection (4); and
the information specified in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be submitted on behalf of the proposed general partner by a Hong Kong firm or a solicitor; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: be accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: the specified fee payable for lodging the application; and
the specified fee payable for the registration.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(c)(iii), the statement is a statement that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any consent to or approval for the intended deregistration of the non-Hong Kong fund in its place of establishment required by any contract entered into or undertaking given by or on behalf of the fund has been obtained or waived;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the intended deregistration of the non-Hong Kong fund in its place of establishment is not prohibited under the law of that place or by any agreement entered into among the partners in the fund; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the proposed general partner understands that if the non-Hong Kong fund is registered as a limited partnership fund, the Registrar may strike the name of the fund off the LPF Register if the fund is not deregistered in its place of establishment within 60 days (or the period extended under section 82E(2)) after the registration date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Hong Kong firm (香港律師行) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159).

section.name: s82C
section.heading: Registration of non-Hong Kong fund as limited partnership fund

subsection.content: The Registrar may, on application, register a non-Hong Kong fund as a limited partnership fund.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not register a non-Hong Kong fund as a limited partnership fund unless the Registrar is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on its registration, the fund meets the eligibility requirements in section 7; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application meets the requirements in section 82B(3).

subsection.content: On registering a non-Hong Kong fund as a limited partnership fund, the Registrar must issue a certificate of registration to the fund.
The certificate of registration is conclusive evidence that the fund is a limited partnership fund.

section.name: s82D
section.heading: Effect of registration of non-Hong Kong fund as limited partnership fund

subsection.leadIn: If a non-Hong Kong fund is registered as a limited partnership fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration does not cause the original partnership to be dissolved;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the original partnership continues in existence as a limited partnership fund; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: with effect from the registration date, the original partnership is taken to be a limited partnership fund registered under section 12 and this Ordinance applies accordingly to the original partnership (registered as a limited partnership fund).

subsection.leadIn: The registration of a non-Hong Kong fund as a limited partnership fund does not operate to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: create a new legal entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prejudice or affect the continuity of the non-Hong Kong fund as a partnership established in its place of establishment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: affect any contract made, resolution passed or any other thing done by or in relation to the non-Hong Kong fund;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: render defective any legal proceedings commenced or continued by, on behalf of or against the non-Hong Kong fund.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, on and after the registration date, any legal proceedings that could have been commenced or continued by, on behalf of or against the non-Hong Kong fund may be commenced or continued by, on behalf of or against the limited partnership fund.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with effect from the registration date, all property of the original partnership is the property of the limited partnership fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for tax purposes, the registration of the non-Hong Kong fund as a limited partnership fund does not amount to—

subparagraph.content: a transfer of assets of the fund; or
a change in the beneficial ownership of the assets of the fund.

section.name: s82E
section.heading: Deregistration in place of establishment

subsection.content: If a non-Hong Kong fund is registered as a limited partnership fund, the fund must be deregistered in its place of establishment within 60 days after the registration date.

On application by the general partner in the limited partnership fund, the Registrar may extend the 60-day period mentioned in subsection (1) subject to any condition that the Registrar considers appropriate.

section.name: s82F
section.heading: Business registration

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before a non-Hong Kong fund is registered as a limited partnership fund, the original partnership holds a valid business registration certificate, the general partner in the limited partnership fund must, within 1 month after the registration date, notify the Commissioner of Inland Revenue of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name in which the limited partnership fund is registered; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the details of the general partner in the limited partnership fund.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: valid business registration certificate (有效商業登記證) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310).

section.name: s83
section.heading: Offence for claiming entity as limited partnership fund

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an entity—

subparagraph.content: is not a limited partnership fund; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person, for soliciting investors to a business carried on by the entity, claims that the entity is a limited partnership fund.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Offence for pretending to be carrying on business of limited partnership fund

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an entity—

subparagraph.content: is not a limited partnership fund; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person carries on a business of the entity purportedly in the form of a limited partnership fund.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Offence for failure to comply with direction
section.leadIn: If the general partner in a limited partnership fund fails to comply with a direction or requirement given by the Registrar to the fund under this Ordinance, the general partner commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Offence for destroying documents

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person wilfully or maliciously destroys any register, book, or other document that is required by or for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Offence for false statement

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person knowingly or recklessly makes a statement, in any return, report, financial statements, certificate or other information or document required by or for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance, that is false, misleading or deceptive in a material respect.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $300,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not affect the operation of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 19, 20 or 21 of the Theft Ordinance (Cap. 210).

section.name: s88
section.heading: Offence for purported dissolution of limited partnership fund not in compliance with limited partnership agreement

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person purports to dissolve a limited partnership fund in accordance with the limited partnership agreement of the fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the way in which the fund is purportedly dissolved does not comply with the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Defence

subsection.content: In the legal proceedings against a person for a specified offence, it is a defence to establish that the person took all reasonable steps to avoid committing the offence.

subsection.leadIn: The person is taken to have established that the person took all reasonable steps to avoid committing the specified offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue that the person took all reasonable steps to avoid committing the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

section.name: s90
section.heading: Application of Partnership Ordinance to limited partnership fund

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions of the Partnership Ordinance (Cap. 38) apply to a limited partnership fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 2;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sections 3 and 4 (to the extent that they are not inconsistent with this Ordinance);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 19 (to the extent that it is not inconsistent with this Ordinance);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: section 26 (to the extent that it is not inconsistent with this Ordinance);

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (1), the Partnership Ordinance (Cap. 38) does not apply to a limited partnership fund.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Application of rules of equity and of common law
section.content: The rules of equity and of common law applicable to partnerships, to the extent that they are not inconsistent with this Ordinance, apply to a limited partnership fund.

section.name: s92
section.heading: Power of Financial Secretary to make regulations
section.content: The Financial Secretary may make regulations for the better carrying out of the purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Power of Registrar to require production of records

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, for the purposes of investigating whether a limited partnership fund has contravened any provision of this Ordinance, require the fund to produce—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any records or information relating to the operation, or business activities or transactions, of the fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation in respect of the records or information.

subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (1), the records that the Registrar may require include the records kept under section 29.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Power of Registrar to specify form etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, in relation to any document required or authorized to be delivered to the Registrar under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify requirements as to the form of the document;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: specify requirements as to the authentication of the document; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: specify requirements as to the manner of delivery of the document.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), the Registrar may specify different requirements for different documents or classes of documents, or for different circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(c), the Registrar may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the document to be authenticated by a particular person or a person of a particular description;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the means of authentication; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require the document to contain, or to be accompanied by, the name or identification number, or both, of the limited partnership fund to which it relates.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(d), the Registrar may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the document to be in hard copy form, electronic form or any other form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the document to be delivered by post or any other means;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify requirements as to the address to which the document is to be delivered; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a document to be delivered by electronic means—specify requirements as to the hardware and software to be used and the technical specifications.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not empower the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to require a document to be delivered to the Registrar by electronic means; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to specify any requirement that is inconsistent with any requirement prescribed by an Ordinance as to—

subparagraph.content: the authentication of the document; and
the manner of delivery of the document to the Registrar.

subsection.content: Requirements specified under this section are not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: in hard copy form (印本形式) means in paper form or similar form capable of being read.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Registrar not responsible for verifying information

subsection.content: The applicant of an application made under section 11, 79 or 82B must ensure the truth of the information contained in the application. (Amended 34 of 2021 s. 11)
The general partner in a limited partnership fund must ensure the truth of the information contained in a document delivered to the Registrar under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar is not responsible for verifying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the truth of the information contained in the application or document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authority under which the application is made or the document is delivered to the Registrar.

section.name: s96
section.heading: Power of Registrar to notify relevant regulatory authority

subsection.content: The Registrar may notify the relevant regulatory authority of the investment manager of a limited partnership fund in relation to a statement made by the investment manager to the Registrar that is false, misleading or deceptive in a material respect.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1), the relevant regulatory authority includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the investment manager is an authorized institution—the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the investment manager is a licensed corporation—the Securities and Futures Commission; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other authority specified by the Financial Secretary for the purposes of this paragraph in regulations made under section 92.

section.name: s97
section.heading: Immunity

subsection.leadIn: Neither the Registrar nor a public officer is civilly liable for an act done or omitted to be done by the Registrar or the public officer in good faith in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: performing or purportedly performing a function under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exercising or purportedly exercising a power under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not affect any liability of the Government for the act or omission.

subsection.leadIn: Where, for the purposes of this Ordinance, a protected person provides a service by means of which information in electronic form is supplied to the public, or supplies information by means of magnetic tapes or any electronic mode, the protected person is not personally liable for any loss or damage suffered by a user of the service or information by reason of an error or omission appearing in the information if the error or omission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was made in good faith and in the ordinary course of the discharge of the protected person’s duties; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has occurred or arisen as a result of any defect or breakdown in the service or any equipment used for the service or for supplying the information.

subsection.leadIn: Where, for the purposes of this Ordinance, a protected person provides a service or facility by means of which documents may be delivered to the Registrar by electronic means, the protected person is not personally liable for any loss or damage suffered by a user of the service or facility by reason of an error or omission appearing in a document delivered to the Registrar by means of the service or facility if the error or omission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was made in good faith and in the ordinary course of the discharge of the protected person’s duties; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has occurred or arisen as a result of any defect or breakdown in the service or facility or in any equipment used for the service or facility.

subsection.content: Subsections (3) and (4) do not affect any liability of the Government for the error or omission.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: protected person (受保障人) means a person authorized by the Registrar to supply the information or provide the service or facility.

section.name: s98
section.heading: Fees
section.content: A fee specified in column 3 of Schedule 3 is payable to the Registrar in respect of the matter described, opposite the fee, in column 2 of that Schedule.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules
section.content: The Financial Secretary may, by order published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1, 2 or 3.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Information Required in Application for Registration as Limited Partnership Fund

section.name: s1
section.content: The proposed name of the limited partnership fund.

section.name: s2
section.content: The proposed address of the registered office of the limited partnership fund.

section.name: s3
section.content: The proposed investment scope and proposed principal place of business of the limited partnership fund.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: If the person proposed to be the general partner in the limited partnership fund (proposed general partner) is a natural person who is at least 18 years old—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the correspondence address (which must not be a post office box number) of the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of the person’s identity card or, if the person does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by the person; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the signature of the person.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: If the proposed general partner is a private company limited by shares incorporated under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or a former Companies Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the company’s registered office;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of the company’s business registration certificate; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the signature of a director or company secretary of the company.

section.name: s5A
section.leadIn: If the proposed general partner is a private company limited by shares that is a re-domiciled company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the company’s registered office;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of the company’s business registration certificate; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the signature of a director or company secretary of the company. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 289)

section.name: s6
section.leadIn: If the proposed general partner is a registered non-Hong Kong company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of the company’s business registration certificate; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the signature of a director, company secretary, manager, or authorized representative (as defined by section 774(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)) of the company.

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: If the proposed general partner is a limited partnership registered under the Limited Partnerships Ordinance (Cap. 37)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of the limited partnership;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the limited partnership’s principal place of business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of the limited partnership’s business registration certificate; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the signature of a general partner in the limited partnership.

section.name: s8
section.leadIn: If the proposed general partner is another limited partnership fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of the fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the fund’s registered office;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of the fund’s business registration certificate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the signature of the general partner in, or (if applicable) the authorized representative of, the fund;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the full name of—

subparagraph.content: a Hong Kong resident who is at least 18 years old;
a company; or
a registered non-Hong Kong company,

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a statement that the proposed authorized representative consents to be the authorized representative of the limited partnership fund.

section.name: s9
section.leadIn: If the proposed general partner is a non-Hong Kong limited partnership with a legal personality—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of the limited partnership;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the limited partnership’s principal place of business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of the limited partnership’s business registration certificate (if any); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the signature of a general partner in the limited partnership.

section.name: s10
section.leadIn: If the proposed general partner is a non-Hong Kong limited partnership without a legal personality—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of the limited partnership;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the limited partnership’s principal place of business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of the limited partnership’s business registration certificate (if any);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the signature of a general partner in the limited partnership;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the full name of—

subparagraph.content: a Hong Kong resident who is at least 18 years old;
a company; or
a registered non-Hong Kong company,

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a statement that the proposed authorized representative consents to be the authorized representative of the limited partnership fund.

section.name: s11
section.leadIn: For items 8(e) and 10(e)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the proposed authorized representative is a Hong Kong resident—

subparagraph.content: the correspondence address (which must not be a post office box number) of the Hong Kong resident;
the number of the Hong Kong resident’s identity card; and
the signature of the Hong Kong resident;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the proposed authorized representative is a company—

subparagraph.content: the address of the company’s registered office;
the number of the company’s business registration certificate; and
the signature of a director or company secretary of the company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the proposed authorized representative is a registered non-Hong Kong company—

subparagraph.content: the address of the company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong;
the number of the company’s business registration certificate; and
the signature of a director, company secretary, manager, or authorized representative (as defined by section 774(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)) of the company.

section.name: s12
section.leadIn: The full name of the person proposed to be the investment manager of the limited partnership fund (proposed investment manager) and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the proposed investment manager is a Hong Kong resident, the number of the Hong Kong resident’s identity card; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the proposed investment manager is a company or registered non-Hong Kong company, the number of the company’s business registration certificate.

section.name: s13
section.leadIn: The full name of the person proposed to be a responsible person of the limited partnership fund (proposed responsible person) and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of the proposed responsible person’s identity card or, if the proposed responsible person does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by the proposed responsible person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the proposed responsible person is an entity other than a natural person, the number of the proposed responsible person’s identification document specified in the application form.

section.name: s14
section.leadIn: A declaration and undertaking from the applicant, by way of signature on the application form, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fund is intended to be set up as a limited partnership fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fund meets the eligibility requirements in section 7.

section.name: s15
section.leadIn: One of the following statements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement that not all the proposed partners in the fund are corporations in the same group of companies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a statement that—

subparagraph.content: all the proposed partners in the fund are corporations in the same group of companies; and

the applicant understands that if the fund is registered as a limited partnership fund, the Registrar may strike the name of the fund off the LPF Register if all the partners in the fund are corporations in the same group of companies after the second anniversary of the date on which its certificate of registration is issued. (Amended 34 of 2021 s. 12)

section.name: s16
section.content: A confirmation on whether or not the records that the fund will be required to keep under section 29 will be kept in the office referred to in item 2 and, if the records will be kept in another place in Hong Kong, the address of that other place.

section.name: s17
section.content: A statement that the applicant understands that it is an offence to make a statement in the application that is false, misleading or deceptive in a material respect.

section.name: s18
section.content: The full name and contact information of the Hong Kong firm or solicitor referred to in section 11(2)(d) or 82B(3)(d) and, if the solicitor is practising in sole proprietorship, the number of the solicitor’s business registration certificate. (Amended 34 of 2021 s. 12)

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Activities not Regarded as Management of Limited Partnership Fund

section.name: s1
section.content: Acting as an agent, member, contractor, officer or employee of the limited partnership fund. Serving on a board or committee of the fund. Exercising any powers or authority or performing any obligations in the capacity of the above positions.

section.name: s2
section.content: Acting as an agent, director, shareholder, member, contractor, officer or employee of the general partner in the fund. Serving on a board or committee of the general partner. Exercising any powers or authority or performing any obligations in the capacity of the above positions.

section.name: s3
section.content: Authorizing a person to act as an agent, member, contractor, officer or employee of the fund.

section.name: s4
section.content: Authorizing a person to act as an agent, director, shareholder, member, contractor, officer or employee of the general partner in the fund.

section.name: s5
section.content: Appointing a person to serve on a board or committee of the fund or of the general partner in the fund, or revoking such appointment.

section.name: s6
section.content: Entering into, or acting under, a contract with the general partner or a limited partner in the fund, which does not require, or the action under which does not involve, a limited partner taking part in the day-to-day management of the fund.

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: Serving on the board of directors, or a committee, of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any corporation in which the fund has an interest; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any corporation providing management, consultation, custody or other services to the fund, or having a business relationship with the fund.

section.name: s8
section.leadIn: Appointing a person to serve on the board of directors, or a committee, of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any corporation in which the fund has an interest; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any corporation providing management, consultation, custody or other services to the fund, or having a business relationship with the fund,

section.name: s9
section.leadIn: Discussing with or advising—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the general partner or another limited partner in the fund; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the investment manager of the fund,

section.continued: about the business, prospects, affairs or transactions of the fund.

section.name: s10
section.leadIn: Approving or authorizing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the general partner or another limited partner in the fund; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the investment manager of the fund,

section.continued: to do anything in connection with the business, prospects, affairs or transactions of the fund.

section.name: s11
section.content: Calling, requesting, attending or participating in a meeting of the partners in the fund.

section.name: s12
section.content: Exercising any right or power conferred under the limited partnership agreement of the fund, other than a power to carry out management functions, but including the right to vote on or signify approval or disapproval to any proposed transaction of the fund.

section.name: s13
section.content: Consulting, investigating, reviewing, approving or advising on the accounts, the valuation or the assets of the fund or the affairs of the fund.

section.name: s14
section.content: Acting as a guarantor for the fund or for the general partner in the fund.

section.name: s15
section.content: Approving or disapproving an amendment to the limited partnership agreement of the fund or taking part in a decision about the variation of, or waiver of a term of, the limited partnership agreement or associated documents.

section.name: s16
section.content: Commencing, continuing or defending, or instructing a person to commence, continue or defend, legal proceedings on behalf of the fund if the general partner in the fund has refused to do so without good reason.

section.name: s17
section.content: Having the whole or a part of the name of the limited partner included in the name of the fund.

section.name: s18
section.leadIn: Taking part in a decision about—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether a person should become or cease to be the general partner or a limited partner in the fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether an application should be made for the deregistration of the fund, or whether the fund should be dissolved;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the term of the fund should be extended;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: changes in the persons responsible for the day-to-day management of the fund;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the incurrence or renewal of indebtedness by the fund;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a change in the investment scope of the fund;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: entering into contracts with other parties in relation to the business of the fund;

paragraph.name: h

paragraph.content: the exercise of the fund’s rights in respect of an investment;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the participation by a limited partner in the fund in a particular investment by the fund; or

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the creation, extension, variation or discharge of any other obligation owed by the fund.
